comments:
Experimental Organic Chemistry I is a basic laboratory course in which both the theoretical and practical aspects of a variety of organic reactions and multi-step syntheses are emphasized. The class applies modern chromatographic, instrumental, and spectroscopic techniques to experimental organic chemistry, according to the course description. The course should be taken concurrently with Chem 242, or in the semester immediately following.  An additional prerequisite for the course is Chem 241.  

Many of the students in the course were upperclassmen, and most took it as part of the premed and major requirement. As for the TAs, most students felt that they were very helpful and knowledgeable.  Students were also pleased with Professor Mallory, describing her as “awesome,” and “excellent.”  As one student commented, “Dr. Mallory led a very interesting, educational lab course.”

Some students found the course to be very work-intensive. Many complaints centered on the lab reports, which required what some thought an excessive amount of writing.  One student described them as “painful.”  However, students believed that they had learned a considerable amount from the lab experience.  The lab fee for the course was $300.
